analyzed: tiṇa sūlaka chāda niya tthera apadāna

translated: I went forth from the home life.
I came to the bank of the Ganges;
on the bank of the Ganges, level.
Having had a hermitage built there,
My walking path was well made,
with a multitude of various birds.
the king of the deer, with four legs,
having come out from his dwelling,
When the king of the deer was roaring,
Seeking the king of the deer,
I saw the Leader of the World.

analyzed: disvān aham devadeva  tissam lokagga nāyaka
translated: Having seen the God of Gods,🔽Tissa, the Leader of the World,
The one who delights the world, the leader of the world.
‘By your knowledge, all-knowing one,🔽You liberate this world with its gods;
We will be freed from birth.🔽Not seeing the all-knowing one,
They fall into the Avīci hell.
They are freed from all existences,
When the Buddhas, who have vision,
Arise, the lights of the world,
Having praised the Fully Enlightened One,🔽Tissa, the leader of the world,
Tissa, the leader of the world,
Listen to me as I speak:
He was a wheel-turning monarch twenty-five times,
He will be King of the Gods
and he will be a Universal Monarch🔽seventy-five times.
He will have a vast kingdom
by the result of that deed
and by worshipping with flowers.🔽If a person who has had his head shaved
Whatever he desires with his wishes
he will be extinguished, without defilements.’
I have no lack of anything,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Now I have attained the Deathless,
Having fully understood all the pollutants,
Twenty-two eons ago,🔽I worshipped with a flower.
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Welcome indeed it was for me
I have done the Buddha’s bidding.

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā tiṇasūlakachādaniyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā tiṇasūlakachādaniyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: I have done the Buddha’s bidding.”🔽Thus the elder Tiṇasūla-kachādaniya recited these verses.
The pericope of the elder Tiṇasūla-kachādaniya is finished.
